info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 8 at 10:52AM EDT until July 10 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Cape Fear River At Fayetteville affecting Cumberland County.
Little River At Manchester affecting Cumberland County.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little River at Manchester.
* WHEN...Until early Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor flooding begins in Fort Liberty near the water treatment plant. At 23.0 feet, Minor flooding begins on Manchester Road near the Fort Liberty water treatment plant. At 24.0 feet, Manchester Road is flooded. At 25.0 feet, Water reaches the base of the Manchester Road bridge and the foundation of the Starlite motel at the intersection of Manchester Road and Bragg Blvd (Hwy 24/87).
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 12.6 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 08/11/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued this evening.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING
